abstract: The tiny mass in Long Island Sound was sold at auction for $160,000 to an undisclosed buyer.
snippet: The tiny mass in Long Island Sound was sold at auction for $160,000 to an undisclosed buyer.
lead_paragraph: Rat Island, a tiny lump of rock in Long Island Sound that is home to birds, mussel shells and not much else, has sold for $160,000, after about 25 minutes of bidding among a half-dozen prospective buyers, said Ozzie Crisalli, of Syracuse Realty Group, which represented the property at auction Sunday in City Island.

headline.main: The Cost to Own a New York Island
